comment: This is a printed page from an ancient Chinese text, likely a copy or edition of 'Shuowen Jiezi' (說文解字), as indicated by the title '說文解字標目' (Shuowen Jiezi Biaomu, meaning 'Index/Title Page of Shuowen Jiezi'). The main content consists of columns of Chinese characters in seal script (篆書), each followed by its phonetic annotation (反切) in regular script. The leftmost column contains a vertical note discussing the dating and authenticity of the text, mentioning '癸巳四月初六日' (the sixth day of the fourth month in the year Gui Si), '郭恕先' (Guo Shuxian), '徐騎省' (Xu Qixing), and '夢英石刻之謬也' (the errors in Meng Ying's stone carvings). The page number '大十五' (Da Shi Wu, meaning 'Large Fifteen') appears vertically on the far left margin. The layout is traditional, with black ink on aged paper, framed by a thick black border.
